item.title: Learn `sed` and be happy
item.description: When you’re done reading this article, you’ll be ready to become a sed expert. Yes, you read it right – So let’s hit the ground running. What is sed? Ever wanted to edit a file without having to open it in a text editor? Or maybe you want to modify several files and don’t want to do it manually? With sed, you just issue a short command in the terminal and bam!

item.title: Encodings part 2: The down and dirty of UTF-8
item.description: What the double UTF is UTF-8? Let’s decode this, bit-by-bit. This is part 2 of a series of posts on Unicode and encodings: Encodings Part 1: Unicode, ASCII, UTF-8 and… Latin-1? Encodings Part 2: The down and dirty of UTF-8 Encodings Part 3: The down and dirty of UTF-16 Unicode and UTF-8 In part 1, we dug a little deeper into the reasons to be for Unicode and found out that Unicode is an immense character table containing all the characters in the world.

item.title: Encodings part 3: The down and dirty of UTF-16
item.description: This is part 3 of a series of posts on Unicode and encodings: Encodings Part 1: Unicode, ASCII, UTF-8 and… Latin-1? Encodings Part 2: The down and dirty of UTF-8 Encodings Part 3: The down and dirty of UTF-16 A very short background At the end of the ’80s, there were two competing forces for standardizing character sets: ISO 10646 and Unicode. ISO was idealistic and Unicode was pragmatic. ISO created a character set containing more than 2 billion code points (of course, most were not allocated).
